required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chronic Kidney Disease and Cardiovascular Disease Risk Assessment
clinical_study.official_title: Chronic Kidney Disease and Cardiovascular Disease Risk Assessment in Yakima County

lead_sponsor.agency: Pacific Northwest University of Health Sciences

clinical_study.source: Pacific Northwest University of Health Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate chronic kidney disease (CKD) and cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk factors in a sample population of Hispanics/Latinos and Caucasians in Yakima county that are rural dwelling. This investigation is intended to provide information on the impact rural geographical location and social determinants of health (SDOH) have on CKD and CVD risk factors.

detailed_description.textblock:
Yakima County has a large hispanic farmworker population. The peak work times are between May and September. There is a growing body of research that shows the risk of agricultural workers in work environments with extreme heat.
The purpose of this pilot study is to look at incidence of non-diagnosed chronic kidney disease within Yakima County to inform future studies to examine other factors and unique bio-markers that may help in the early diagnosis of heat related injuries in agricultural workers.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of undiagnosed chronic kidney disease in farmworkers in Yakima County, WA
primary_outcome.description: Finger stick and urinalysis will be done at the time of screening

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of undiagnosed diabetes mellitus in farmworkers in Yakima County, WA
secondary_outcome.description: Finger stick will be done at the time of screening

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of undiagnosed hypertension in farmworkers in Yakima, County, WA

intervention.description: Urinalysis by dip stick looking for urine protein level
Finger stick looking for serum creatinine as an estimate of renal function

study_pop.textblock: All adults of between the ages of 18 and 75 who do not meet the exclusion criteria and wish to undergo screening for kidney disease and diabetes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Between the ages of 18 and 75
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active malignancy
- Currently pregnant
- End stage renal disease requiring dialysis
- Current active treatment for diabetes mellitus
- Current care by a nephrologist for chronic kidney disease
